qas.question: Where are racial preferences highlighted the most in the United States?

answers.text: admission to universities and other forms of higher education

qas.question: What is another term for kids who get preferential treatment due to their parents attending the same university?
Which case that went to the Supreme Court resulted in a decision regarding public universities and affirmative action?
What are public universities not allowed to do?

answers.text: set specific numerical targets based on race for admissions or employment

qas.question: Instead of being allowed to set numerical targets, what did the Court rule that universities are allowed to do?

answers.text: "goals" and "timetables" for diversity could be set

plausible_answers.text: admission to universities and other forms of higher education

qas.question: Where are racial preferences highlighted the most in the UK?
What is another term for kids who don't get preferential treatment due to their parents attending the same university?
Which case that went to the Supreme Court resulted in a decision regarding private universities and affirmative action?

plausible_answers.text: set specific numerical targets based on race for admissions or employment

qas.question: What are public universities allowed to do?

context: In the US, a prominent form of racial preferences relates to access to education, particularly <a0_0><b5_0>admission to universities and other forms of higher education<b5_0/><a0_0/>. Race, ethnicity, native language, social class, geographical origin, parental attendance of the university in question (<a1_0><b6_0>legacy admissions<b6_0/><a1_0/>), and/or gender are sometimes taken into account when the university assesses an applicant's grades and test scores. Individuals can also be awarded scholarships and have fees paid on the basis of criteria listed above. In 1978, the Supreme Court ruled in <a2_0><b7_0>Bakke v. Regents<b7_0/><a2_0/> that public universities (and other government institutions) could not <a3_0><b8_0>set specific numerical targets based on race for admissions or employment<b8_0/><a3_0/>. The Court said that <a4_0>"goals" and "timetables" for diversity could be set<a4_0/> instead.
